thread.title: New Mackinac Island ferry to be christened
thread.title_full: New Mackinac Island ferry to be christened - seattlepi.com

author: seattlepi
title: New Mackinac Island ferry to be christened
text:
MACKINAW CITY, Mich. (AP) â€” The newest ferry in a Mackinac Island fleet is set to be christened by Gov. Rick Snyder and Shepler's Ferry CEO Bill Shepler .
The new $3.8 million, 85-foot ship named "Miss Margy" was built at Moran Iron Works in Onaway. It's undergoing final preparations in Mackinaw City before its maiden voyage to Mackinac Island later this summer.
Snyder, U.S. Rep. Dan Benishek , state lawmakers and others are planning to attend a Sunday afternoon christening ceremony in Mackinaw City.
The 281-passenger ferry will be the largest of Shepler's fleet and has a top speed of about 40 mph. Shepler's says components were bought from Michigan companies to the extent possible.
